medical_history.chief_complaint: Right-sided epigastric pain that was crampy in quality.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with the first episode of sudden onset right-sided epigastric pain, occurring less than 24 hours before the visit after consuming a fatty meal the previous night. No abdominal pain was noted the day prior, indicating a rapid onset of inflammation and pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hypertension 2. Hypercholesterolemia 3. Cataracts 4. Basal cell carcinoma 5. Aortic stenosis 6. Depression. Previous surgeries include CABG and open hysterectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of heart failure; mother died of uterus cancer.
